revised_title: Adenine Transport Mechanisms in Escherichia Coli
tldr: The author investigates adenine transport in Escherichia coli, discovering two transport routes: a high-affinity route requiring metabolic removal of adenine and a low-affinity route that is not energy-dependent. The gene for the high-affinity route is localized to a specific restriction fragment and is found to involve the open-reading frame f445. This discovery helps understand the role of membrane proteins in adenine transport and the regulation of transport systems in bacteria.
